image:image.image:title: First Attempt, Reflections of Calm
image:image.image:caption: After attending Arts and Crafts society at Glasgow University I decided to give painting a go. I followed along to Bob Ross painting Reflections of Calm. The only times I had tried up to this point were during primary school, and much later when my friend convinced me to attend Arts and Crafts society. We made Christmas cards.

image:image.image:title: Trying Out Oil, Delightful Meadow Home
image:image.image:caption: As I had so much fun doing my first paintings, I decided to upgrade from the acrylic paints and printer paper I used. So I borrowed some oil paints and paper and followed Bob Ross painting Delightful Meadow Home. I liked how it was without the shed so decided to stop a bit early

image:image.image:title: Time To Buy Supplies, Evening's Glow
image:image.image:caption: As I had so much fun doing my first two painting I decided i would finally bite the bullet and buy some art supplies. That weekend I headed to my local art shop and got myself a set of paintbrushes, some oil paints and paper to match. When I got home, as always, I put on Bob Ross and painted along to Evening's Glow. I got a bit carried away with the hills and just kept going.

image:image.image:title: Going Solo, Tree By A Lake
image:image.image:caption: I felt it was finally time to paint something without any guidance. So I left Bob Ross behind, gathered up my art supplies and just went for it. Lacking some confidence I decided to paint on a smaller peace of paper. After a mix of painting and panicking, I ended up with "Tree By A Lake".

image:image.image:title: George, The Bear
image:image.image:caption: This is George, if you haven't already guessed, he's a Bear.

image:image.image:title: Fuchsia Flowers
image:image.image:caption: These are some flowers I saw whilst walking through Kelvingrove park. I thought they looked pretty so I took a picture.
